content: sunshine cottage winter snood by wendy morris © sunshine cottage 2025 snoods and cowls are always cosy on cold days this classic is crocheted and is very simple to construct crocheted in chunky/bulky weight yarn with a 6mm hook this is a good project for less experienced crocheters materials round 4 chain 2 skip next st tc 2 sts tc into 75-100g of any suitable chunky/bulky/12ply skipped st forming a twist repeat to end join weight yarn of your choice using sl-st rounds 5 -7 chain 2 double_crochet to end join using sl-st size round 8 repeat round 4 one size only but size may vary slightly depending rounds 9-11 repeat rounds 5-7 on which type of yarn used round 12 repeat round 4 round 13-14 chain 2 double_crochet 69 sts join using sl-st hook fasten_off 6mm make up notes for knitters sew the small seam at the start of work and sew this snood is crocheted in the round with the in ends neatly block if necessary this will neaten foundation 1st row worked flat sts and improve shape designed to fit an adult snuggly around the neck care please note instructions use uk/english please follow the washing instructions on the label terminology table with us terminology is of your chosen yarn included hand crocheted items are best gently hand washed in lukewarm water and dried flat abbreviations chain = chain st = stitch #wintersnood #crochetsnood #sunshinecottage double_crochet = double_crochet tc = triple crochet _sunshinecottage_ sunshinecottageuk sl-st = slip_stitch uk/us terminology conversion uk terminology us terminology double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet tc double_crochet double_crochet instructions using 6mm hook chain 71sts 1st row worked flat start at the 2nd chain st double_crochet 69 sts join into a round 2nd round chain 2 double_crochet 69 sts join at end with sl-st 3rd row repeat round 2 all rights reserved reproduction in whole or any part of all material including illustrations in this pattern is
